Filter ASVs Based on Multiple Criteria

filter_asvs.Rd

This function filters ASVs based on multiple user-defined criteria:

  1. Total abundance across all samples ≥ min_total_abundance

  2. Presence in ≥ min_samples_present samples

  3. Abundance ≥ min_abs_abundance_value in ≥ min_samples_present samples

  4. (Optional) Presence in ≥ min_groups_present groups (metadata_df and group_column_name required)

  5. Overall average relative abundance ≥ min_overall_avg_rel_abundance

Usage

filter_asvs(
  asv_counts_df,
  metadata_df = NULL,
  group_column_name = NULL,
  min_samples_present = 0,
  min_abs_abundance_value = 0,
  min_groups_present = 0,
  min_overall_avg_rel_abundance = 0
)

Arguments

asv_counts_df

A data frame: rows = ASV IDs, columns = sample IDs (absolute abundances).

metadata_df

Optional sample metadata (row names = sample IDs).

group_column_name

Optional column name in metadata to use for group filtering.

min_samples_present

Minimum number of samples in which an ASV must appear.

min_abs_abundance_value

Threshold to consider ASV "present" in a sample.

min_groups_present

Minimum number of distinct groups an ASV must appear in.

min_overall_avg_rel_abundance

Minimum average relative abundance across all samples.

Value

Filtered ASV table as a data frame.

Examples

# filtered <- filter_asvs(b_ASV, metadata, "Group", 3, 4, 2, 0.0001, 10)
